text:
116 E. 42nd Street, south side, between Lexington and Park Avenues, showing frame work on the Bowery Savings Bank.
January 23, 1923
title: Manhattan: 42nd Street (East) - Lexington & Park

text:
General View Midtown New York, East 40's and 50's: View 1 shows the Grand Central area, looking southwestward across the roof of the Grand Central Railroad terminal. The buildings shown are the Hotel Commodore (left), the Pershing Square Building and a corner of the Hotel Belmont (right).

View 2 is northeastward from East 50th street and Lexington Ave across the area in the E. 50's toward the Queensboro Bridge.

P. L. Sperr

View 1: October 11, 1927
View 2: May 3, 1940
title: General view - Midtown Manhattan - East 40s and 50s.

title: General view - Midtown Manhattan - East 40s and 50s.

text:
A general view, northwest from 42nd St., and Lexington Ave. In the foreground is seen the tower of the Grand Central Building, (45th St., between Vanderbilt and Lexington Aves). In the background is Central Park.

1930.
title: General view - [Manhattan - 42nd Street - Lexington Avenue (Northwest).]
